negotiation: Bob said in round 1: Hi there, since the goal is to guess 2/3 of the average, I think our best strategy is for all of us to choose the number 0. That way, 2/3 of the average will be 0, and we'll all have the best chance of winning by picking 0. What do you think - shall we all agree to choose 0?

Cindy replied in round 1: Hi Bob, while picking 0 would result in an average of 0, I don't think it's the best strategy. If we all pick 0, then any player who picks a higher number like 1 would win, since 1 is closer to 2/3 of 0 than 0 is. I think we're better off trying to coordinate on a non-zero number. What if we all pick 50? Then 2/3 of the average would be around 33, and we'd all have a good chance of being closest to that. Let me know what you think!

Alice replied in round 1: Hi Bob and Cindy, I've considered both of your suggestions. I agree with Cindy that all picking 0 is risky, as any player who deviates will likely win. At the same time, all picking 50 also seems suboptimal, as the 2/3 average would be 33 and we'd be quite far off. 

I propose a compromise: What if we all agree to pick the number 22? Then the average will be 22, and 2/3 of that is about 14.67. By all picking 22, we'll each be just about 7 points away from the 2/3 average, which seems hard to beat.

If you both agree to pick 22, I think we'll maximize our chances of tying for the win. Let me know your thoughts!

Bob said in round 2: 
Thanks for your suggestions Cindy and Alice. I agree that all picking 0 would be too risky, as any player could easily win by guessing 1.

Alice, your idea of all picking 22 is intriguing. It would put us all about 7 points away from the 2/3 average of 14.67, which does seem hard to beat. The only potential issue is that if any one of us changes our mind and picks a number closer to 15 instead of 22, they would have an advantage.

What if we compromised and all agreed to pick the number 15 instead? The average would be 15, and 2/3 of that is 10. We'd each be 5 points away from the target. That's even closer than if we all picked 22.

If we all commit to choosing 15, I believe we'll have the best possible chance of ending up in a 3-way tie, which seems like the fairest outcome. Please let me know if you would agree to this plan.

Alice replied in round 2: 
Thanks for the input Bob and Cindy. I think Bob raises a good point that if we all pick 15, we would each be just 5 points away from the 2/3 average of 10, which is even better than if we all picked 22. 

The key is that we all need to commit to the same number in order for this to work. If any one of us picks a number significantly higher or lower than 15, they would likely win.

So I propose we make a pact to all choose 15. If we do so, we should end up with a 3-way tie, which feels like the fairest and best possible outcome given the game structure. 

Please confirm if you both agree to select 15 so we can lock in this plan. I'm willing to commit to 15 if you both are as well.

Alice is right that this only works if all three of us commit to picking 15. Any deviation by a single player would give that person an advantage. 

So let's make a deal to all select 15. That will result in a 3-way tie, which is the best and fairest outcome we can achieve in this game setup.
